sentence1: There once lived in Sianfu an old Buddhist monk, who loved to wander in lonely places.
sentence2: In the course of his wanderings he once came to the Kuku-Nor, and there he saw a tree which was a thousand feet high and many cords in breadth.

sentence1: In the course of his wanderings he once came to the Kuku-Nor, and there he saw a tree which was a thousand feet high and many cords in breadth.
sentence2: It was hollow inside and one could see the sky shining down into it from above.

sentence1: It was hollow inside and one could see the sky shining down into it from above.
sentence2: When he had gone on a few miles, he saw in the distance a girl in a red coat, barefoot, and with unbound hair, who was running as fast as the wind.

sentence1: When he had gone on a few miles, he saw in the distance a girl in a red coat, barefoot, and with unbound hair, who was running as fast as the wind.
sentence2: In a moment she stood before him.

sentence1: In a moment she stood before him.
sentence2: "Take pity on me and save my life!"

sentence1: "Take pity on me and save my life!"
sentence2: said she to him.

sentence1: said she to him.
sentence2: When the monk asked her what was the trouble, she replied: "A man is pursuing me.

sentence1: When the monk asked her what was the trouble, she replied: "A man is pursuing me.
sentence2: If you will tell him you have not seen me, I will be grateful to you all my life long!"

sentence1: If you will tell him you have not seen me, I will be grateful to you all my life long!"
sentence2: With that she ran up to the hollow tree and crawled into it.

sentence1: With that she ran up to the hollow tree and crawled into it.
sentence2: When the monk had gone a little further, he met one who rode an armored steed.

sentence1: When the monk had gone a little further, he met one who rode an armored steed.
sentence2: "Have you seen the girl in the red coat?"

sentence1: "Have you seen the girl in the red coat?"
sentence2: asked the stranger.

sentence1: asked the stranger.
sentence2: And when the monk replied that he had seen nothing, the other continued: "Bonze, you should not lie!

sentence1: And when the monk replied that he had seen nothing, the other continued: "Bonze, you should not lie!
sentence2: I have already slain a countless number of them, and have pretty well done away with them.

sentence1: I have already slain a countless number of them, and have pretty well done away with them.
sentence2: Last night the Lord of the Heavens gave me a triple command, and that is the reason I have hurried down from the skies.

sentence1: Last night the Lord of the Heavens gave me a triple command, and that is the reason I have hurried down from the skies.
sentence2: There are eight thousand of us under way in all directions to catch this monster.

sentence1: There are eight thousand of us under way in all directions to catch this monster.
sentence2: If you do not tell the truth, monk, then you are sinning against heaven itself!"

sentence1: If you do not tell the truth, monk, then you are sinning against heaven itself!"
sentence2: Upon that the monk did not dare deceive him, but pointed to the hollow tree.

sentence1: Upon that the monk did not dare deceive him, but pointed to the hollow tree.
sentence2: The messenger of the skies dismounted, stepped into the tree and looked about him.

sentence1: The messenger of the skies dismounted, stepped into the tree and looked about him.
sentence2: The monk looked up and could see a small, red flame come out of the tree-top.
